revised_title: Atropine Uptake and Acetylcholine Receptors in Intestinal Smooth Muscle
tldr: The authors studied the uptake of atropine and related drugs by intestinal smooth muscle of the guinea-pig in relation to acetylcholine receptors. They found that atropine uptake could be related to receptor-bound drug and analyzed the kinetics of atropine uptake and washout. The findings suggest that the uptake behaves passively as a slowly permeant cation and no uptake referable to acetylcholine receptors was detected.
